record.label: Classical mythology 1 (from Chaos to the Titans)
record.Description: Chaos; The formation of the earth; Ouranos and Gaia give birth to the Titans.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Classical mythology 2 (from Chronos to the Olympians)
record.Description: Chronos overthrows Ouranos; the reign of the Titans; the birth of the Olympian gods.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Classical mythology 3 (from Zeus to Pandora)
record.Description: Zeus overthrows Chronos; the reign of the Olympians; the first Olympic games; Prometheus gives fire to mankind; Pandora’s box.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Classical mythology 4 (from the Flood to the Seven against Thebes)
record.Description: Zeus floods the earth; Deucalion and his family survive in an ark; Oedipus kills his father and marries his mother; the twelve labors of Herakles; Orpheus tries to bring back Eurydice from Hades; the Seven against Thebes.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Classical mythology 5 (from Paris's judgement to the fall of Troy)
record.Description: The beauty contest; the capture of Helen; the Trojan war; the capture of Troy.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Classical mythology 6 (return of Odysseus, quest of Aeneas)
record.Description: Odysseus’ journey back to Ithaca; Aeneas’ quest to found Rome.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Indefinite (lasting for an unknown or unstated length of time)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Outside time (time is irrelevant or unapplicable)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Causal arrow of time (from a certain point in time until now)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0001-5515-6545

record.label: Late Antique AD300-640 (Lycia, Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Hungary, Moldova, Serbia, Russia, Ukraine...)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-0438-6049

record.label: Neuzeit (Germany, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Liechtenstein, Austria 1500-1849)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-0438-6049

record.label: Migration Period (Germany, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Liechtenstein, 375-567)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0003-1457-7081

record.label: Arab period (Turkey, Azerbaian, Iran, Iraq, Georgia, Armenia, Syria, 653-1150)
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0003-1457-7081

record.label: Late Antiquity (South-Eastern Europe, 284-600)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe from Emperor Diocletian to the migrations of Slavic tribes in the Balkans.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X

record.label: Middle Ages (South-Eastern Europe, 601-1530)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe from Slavic migrations to the beginnings of Habsburg-Ottoman imperial rivalry.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X

record.label: Early Middle Ages (South-Eastern Europe, 601-1100)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe from Slavic migrations to Hungarian integration of Croatian Kingdom, Crusades and the beginning of the end of Byzantine domination after Manzikert.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X

record.label: High Middle Ages (South-Eastern Europe, 1101 - 1420)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe from Hungarian integration of Croatian Kingdom, Crusades and the beginning of the end of Byzantine domination after Manzikert to the Venetian conquest of Dalmatia and rise of Murad II to the Ottoman Throne.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X

record.label: Late Middle Ages (South-Eastern Europe, 1421 - 1530)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe from the Venetian conquest of Dalmatia and rise of Murad II to the Ottoman Throne to the collapse of Hungarian-Croatian kingdom and the integration of what was left into the Habsburg Empire.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X

record.label: Early Modern Period (South-Eastern Europe, 1531-1805)
record.Description: South-Eastern Europe in the age of Habsburg-Ottoman imperial rivalry and relatively stable regional borders.
record.creator: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9119-399X
